title: Viraj Dayaratne appointed as Solicitor General
byline: President’s Counsel and Senior Additional Solicitor General Viraj Dayaratne has been officially appointed as the new Solicitor General.

title: Over 400,000 affected due to adverse weather in Sri Lanka
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has reported that as at 4.00 pm today (28), the adverse weather conditions have affected a total of 401,707 individuals across Sri Lanka.

title: 7 Iranians sentenced to life in prison on drug charges
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced seven Iranian nationals to life in prison after they were convicted of transporting over 425 kilograms of heroin by boat in the sea area off Mattakkuliya in Colombo in 2019.

title: Australia passes social media ban for children under 16
byline: Australia passed a law on Thursday to ban social media for children aged under 16 after days of heated debate, setting a standard for other countries to follow in a global push to curb the power of Big Tech.

title: Australia passes social media ban for children under 16
byline: Australia passed a law on Thursday to ban social media for children aged under 16 after days of heated debate, setting a standard for other countries to follow in a global push to curb the power of Big Tech.

title: Deep depression’s influence on Sri Lanka’s weather to reduce after tomorrow
byline: The Department of Meteorology says the deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal is likely to move slowly, north-northwestwards closer to the east coast of Sri Lanka and there is a possibility for it to further intensify.

title: Ten new envoys present credentials to President Dissanayake
byline: Nine newly appointed ambassadors and one high commissioner to Sri Lanka have officially presented their credentials to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (28) at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: Ampara tractor incident: four including Madrasa principal and teacher arrested
byline: The principal and a teacher from the Madrasa in Ninthavur, as well as two who had served as assistants to the tractor driver have been arrested in connection with the investigation into the incident where a tractor transporting a group of school children was swept away by floodwaters in Karaitivu, Ampara.

title: Deep depression’s influence on Sri Lanka’s weather to reduce after today
byline: The Meteorology Department says the deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal was located about 240 km northeast of Trincomalee and 290km east of Kankasanthurai around 11.30 p.m. of 28th November 2024.

title: Putin says Russia could hit ‘decision-making centres’ in Kyiv with new missile
byline: Russia may use its new Oreshnik hypersonic missile to attack “decision-making centres” in Kyiv in response to Ukraine’s firing of Western missiles at Russian territory, President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday.

title: Man snatched by crocodile in Pottuvil
byline: A man has reportedly been snatched by a crocodile in the Crocodile Rock area of Pottuvil police division.

title: Indian and Sri Lankan Navy seize 500 kg of crystal meth from fishing boats
byline: In a well-coordinated operation, the Indian Navy, in collaboration with the Sri Lankan Navy on Friday successfully seized approximately 500 kg of narcotics, identified as Crystal Meth, from two fishing boats in the Arabian Sea.

title: Over 441,000 affected by adverse weather in Sri Lanka
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) reports that a total of 441,590 individuals from 132,110 families across 24 districts have been impacted by the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: 10 sluice gates opened at Rajanganaya Reservoir
byline: Ten sluice gates of the Rajanganaya Reservoir have been opened following heavy rainfall.

title: Mound of earth blocks road in Nawalapitiya
byline: Nawalapitiya Police said that traffic movement on the Nawalapitiya - Dolosbage road has been completely halted due to a mound of earth and several trees collapsing on the road.

title: K-Pop group NewJeans split from agency in mistreatment row
byline: Chart-topping K-pop group NewJeans have said they are leaving their agency after accusing it of “mistreatment” and “manipulation”.

title: Rajitha and two others acquitted from ‘white van’ case
byline: The Colombo High Court has acquitted former Minister Rajitha Senaratne and two others in the case related to the controversial ‘white van’ media conference held in 2019.

title: ‘Rajarata Rejina’ train derails in Colombo
byline: The ‘Rajarata Rejina’ train travelling from Anuradhapura to Beliatta has derailed this morning (29) between the Colombo Fort and the Secretariat Halt railway stations.

title: Indonesian rescuers search for missing in buried cars and bus after landslide in Sumatra
byline: Indonesian rescuers on Friday searched for survivors buried in three cars and bus at the base of a cliff after flash floods and landslides in North Sumatra province killed at least 29 people.

title: Chinese envoy responds to claims over ‘debt trap’ and ‘white elephant’ projects in Sri Lanka
byline: The Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Qi Zhenhong, says that while some critics label the large-scale projects implemented in Sri Lanka with Chinese financial assistance as “white elephants,” all such projects were developed according to the requests of the governments in power at the time.

title: Fatal car crash in India sparks concerns over Google Maps
byline: Can a navigation app be held responsible if a user gets into an accident?

title: Minister Vijitha Herath appears before court
byline: Minister Vijitha Herath appeared before the Colombo High Court today (29) to testify in connection with a bribery case filed during the administration of the ‘Good Governance’ Government.

title: Colombo’s inflation drops to -2.1% in Nov. 2024
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has decreased to -2.1% in November 2024, compared to -0.8% in October 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Political stability an important factor for long-term economic growth – CBSL chief
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe says Sri Lanka’s economy is now in a much more stable position and that the present political stability is an important factor for long-term, sustainable economic development.

title: No changes to privileges granted to MPs
byline: The Secretary-General of Parliament, Kushani Rohanadeera stated that there will be no changes to the privileges granted to the Members of the Parliament.

title: Water cut in parts of Colombo
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced that the water supply to several areas in Colombo has been suspended until 6.00 a.m. tomorrow (Nov. 30).

title: Farmers to be compensated for crop damage due to bad weather
byline: Minister of Agriculture and Irrigation K.D. Lal Kantha says that farmers whose fields have been damaged due to inclement weather conditions will be provided with all assistance to revive their agricultural activities.

title: ‘Red’ alert issued for Cyclone ‘FENGAL’: Severe weather expected, impact to reduce after today
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ alert warning for the Cyclone “FENGAL” over Southwest Bay of Bengal for the land, the deep and shallow sea areas around the island.

title: 6 sentenced to death over murder at funeral in Narahenpita
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced six defendants to death for the murder of one person and causing injuries to several others during a 2016 incident at a funeral in Narahenpita.

title: AG will not represent former IGP and Defense Secretary, court told
byline: The Attorney General’s Department today informed the Supreme Court that it will not represent former Inspector General of Police (IGP) C.D. Wickramaratne and former Defense Secretary...

title: Death toll due to adverse weather climbs to 15
byline: The Department of Meteorology has announced that the impact of the deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal on the country’s weather system is expected to diminish starting today.
